intro: Solanum chenopodium, commonly known as nightshade or wild tobacco, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate leaves that are often hairy and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, followed by berries that mature to a dark blue or black hue. Solanum chenopodium is native to various regions in the Americas and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It has both ornamental and medicinal uses, though some parts of the plant contain toxic compounds.
